results.title: All in the family
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Documentary highlighting the value of family therapy. Shows scenes in a controlled therapy session where a girl’s problems are discussed with her family. Discusses certain illnesses such as anorexia nervosa and the approach for dealing with this disease showing the progression of the therapy sessions. No other credits available.

results.title: All in a lifetime
results.creator_credit: Esso Petrol, John Shearman, Derek Armstrong and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: The film marks the 75th. Anniversary of the Esso Petroleum Company and surveys the progress of the oil industry from 1888 to the present day. Within a lifetime, the oil industry has revolutionised our habits and daily life. Historical black and white film shows the first methods of exploration and drilling, then the film pursues oil’s more modern ramifications ranging from the development of the jet engine to the latest oilfields; from laboratory research to motorways; from oil-fired industries to the new world of petrochemicals.

results.title: All in a day
results.brief_description: Filmed at Bradfield Park in New South Wales. The film shows how children can create their own world even in adverse situations. The children’s centre interests young people from pre-school to teenage in painting, drama, dancing and other social activities.

results.title: All I Need Is You

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: The music video, directed by Richard Maxwell, by Rab Cantor, off his album Not a Trampoline.
description_for_label: The music video, directed by Richard Maxwell, by Rab Cantor, off his album Not a Trampoline.

results.title: All I need is a conference
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss, General Electric and Robert Wilmot
results.brief_description: Illustrates the uses that meetings and conferences can be made to serve, if guided by a trained and competent leader. Shows how the behaviour of people attending meetings is basically affected by the personal concerns they bring with them. Points out that the conference leader can deal successfully with the problem on the table only if he understands how to deal with the people around it. Dramatizes the pitfalls that can beset any meeting and the steps to take in order to avoid them.

results.title: All girl melody makers
results.brief_description: Musical performance with no dialogue from an all-female orchestra “Dave Schooler and his 21 Swinghearts”. Items performed: “Tchaikowskiana”, “Pavanne”, “In an 18th Century Drawing Room”.

results.title: All down history (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nick Brenton, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Special Needs in Education”.
Looks at the history of Mongolism and school provision for Down’s syndrome children. Compares a school for severely subnormal children with a high proportion of Down’s children, with a school for children with moderate learning difficulties and two Down’s children, and finally with a local comprehensive school with one Down’s child

results.title: All around us: radiation
results.creator_credit: Gerard Holdsworth Productions and Derek Cunningham
results.brief_description: Explains radiation, how it was discovered and how it is measured. Considers its applications and possible effects on health. Shows how radiation is used to our benefit in industry, medicine and research.

results.title: All America roses
results.brief_description: Shows how rose growers throughout the United States compete for the label “All-America-Rose” selection. Shows the checking of blooms at test stations where the best roses are brought to perfection; close-up studies of different varieties of roses; the use of roses in landscape gardening and interior decoration. Narrated by Peter Allen.
